import { EuiFormRow, EuiFieldText, EuiFlexGroup, EuiFlexGrid, EuiFlexItem, EuiPanel, EuiButton } from '@elastic/eui';

This page documents patterns for form layout, validation and how best to use various components.

## Key Principles

### Help users achieve success

Our form components try to be as informative and clear as possible for the user to avoid errors or confusion.

<EuiFlexGrid columns={3} gutterSize="l">
  <EuiPanel paddingSize="m">
    <h4>Use labels and descriptions</h4>
    Use a [label](#labels) (and [description](#described-groups) if needed) for each form field. All form fields should be considered required unless stated alongside the label.
  </EuiPanel>
  <EuiPanel paddingSize="m">
    <h4>Provide help text</h4>
    Show validation parameters in the [help text](#hint-text) below the input. For example: Spaces and special characters are not allowed.
  </EuiPanel>
  <EuiPanel paddingSize="m">
    <h4>Validate on blur</h4>
    [Validation](../form_validation/guidelines.mdx) should occur on blur from an input field. The submit button should be active by default, then show errors after click. Error messages should be specific to the situation.
  </EuiPanel>
</EuiFlexGrid>

### Provide transparency

It should be clear to users what they can accomplish in each part of the form.

<EuiFlexGrid columns={2} gutterSize="l">
  <EuiPanel paddingSize="m">
    <h4>Layout matters</h4>
    A well-formatted layout makes it clear to users how to navigate the form. As one field is completed, it should be clear where to go next.
  </EuiPanel>
  <EuiPanel paddingSize="m">
    <h4>Words matter</h4>
    Form labels and descriptions are equally important as layout and should be treated with just as much care. The text should be specific, concise, and easy to scan.
  </EuiPanel>
</EuiFlexGrid>

### Maintain a standard layout

Keep the form divided into two columns, with the descriptions on one side and form fields on the other.

<EuiFlexGroup gutterSize="m">
  <Guideline
    type="do"
    panelPadding="m"
    panelStyle={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}
    text="To make groupings clearer and keep the user's eye in one path, it's better to keep inputs in a single column. If multiple fields are needed, they should still remain within the column."
  >
    <img alt="Proper field alignment" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline
    type="dont"
    panelStyle={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}
    text="Avoid nesting form rows. It creates an uneven path for the user's eye to travel down the form."
  >
    <img alt="Incorrect field alignment" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGroup>

### Divide the form into sections

As a form grows longer, it's best to divide the form into sections. This helps the user quickly scan the form and provides visual breaks between multiple input fields.

<EuiFlexGroup gutterSize="m">
  <Guideline
    type="do"
    panelPadding="m"
    panelStyle={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}
    text="Adding visual indicators can help clearly define the sections of the form."
  >
    <img alt="Proper use of dividers" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline
    type="dont"
    panelStyle={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}
    text="Using panels within panels creates too much visual noise and can make it confusing where sections begin and end."
  >
    <img alt="Incorrect use of panels" src="https://eui.elastic.co/images/71667d9604abfbcfc444-form-row--05.svg" />
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGroup>



<EuiFlexGroup gutterSize="m">
  <Guideline
    type="do"
    panelPadding="m"
    panelStyle={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}
    text="Add more spacing between form groups than fields within the group to better define the grouping."
  >
    <img alt="Proper use of spacing" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline
    type="dont"
    panelStyle={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}
    text="Avoid using the same spacing between groups and individual fields. It is harder for the user to scan and understand the sections of the form."
  >
    <img alt="incorrect use of spacing" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGroup>

## Described groups

An [**EuiDescribedFormGroup**](./described_form_group.mdx) provides an additional heading along with description text for a single input or set of input fields.

<EuiPanel hasShadow paddingSize="none" style={{ maxInlineSize: 600, marginInline: 'auto' }}>
  <img src="https://eui.elastic.co/images/5755e6a0170da3714612-form-row--toggle.gif" alt="" />
</EuiPanel>

### When to use it

This component is not intended for every type of form, but typically works best in the following scenarios.

1. **Forms with lengthy descriptions per input**<br />
If a longer description is needed, use an **EuiDescribedFormGroup** to divide the form into a column for descriptions and a column for form fields. This is so there is space for descriptions to aid new users, but keeps the form fields in a column, so frequent users can still quickly navigate the form. Try to limit the description to three sentences or less.

2. **Forms with multiple inputs falling under a single heading**<br />
If multiple sub-steps are needed, grouping them together using an **EuiDescribedFormGroup** helps show they are all still related.

3. **Forms with complex nested options**<br />
A described group is useful when there are parts of the form that can be hidden and shown by the user. The toggle to hide and show the row should be beneath the description and the following form fields should be in the right column with the other form fields.

## Form copy

### Labels

Avoid long labels, but don't sacrifice clarity. If needed, put additional information in help text and tooltips.

<EuiFlexGrid columns={2}>
  <Guideline type="do" text="Say what the field is in the label. Use help text for additional information.">
    <EuiFormRow
      label="Version"
      helpText="Use the `major.minor` format. You can use wildcards `*` to span over multiple versions."
    >
      <EuiFieldText placeholder="2.*" />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline type="dont" text="Put everything in the label. It's hard to scan.">
    <EuiFormRow label="Numeric version (e.g. `2.*`)">
      <EuiFieldText />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGrid>

### Hint text

Place hints and instructions outside a text field so it is always visible to the user. Keep the hint text short, maximum two sentences long. Use hint text to:

- Explain **why you are asking a certain question**: "We will only email you if there is a problem with your order."
- Provide **clarifying details** on what to type: "Enter the full 32-character ID."
- Tell the user **where to find the information** you're asking for: "Find the Elasticsearch cluster ID on the main administration page of your deployment."

<EuiFlexGrid columns={2}>
  <Guideline type="do" text="Help users make the right decision by clarifying what goes inside a field.">
    <EuiFormRow
      label="Timeout"
      helpText="Use shorthand notation, such as 30s, 10m, or 1h."
    >
      <EuiFieldText />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline type="do" text="Use complete sentences and ending punctuation.">
    <EuiFormRow
      label="Name"
      helpText="This is the name that will be visible to other users."
    >
      <EuiFieldText />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGrid>

### Placeholder text

Use the placeholder property to describe the expected value of the input or to provide a useful example.

<EuiFlexGrid columns={2}>
  <Guideline type="do" text="Provide a simple example that highlights the expected syntax or value.">
    <EuiFormRow
      label="Phone number"
      helpText="Include the international call prefix."
    >
      <EuiFieldText placeholder="+33600000000" />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline type="dont" text="Start with `for example`, or `e.g.`.">
    <EuiFormRow label="Endpoint" helpText="Include the port number.">
      <EuiFieldText placeholder="e.g. https://example.com:9500" />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGrid>

Add placeholder text in addition to field labels and help text, not as a replacement. Omit it if it doesn't add value for users. And keep it short.

<EuiFlexGrid columns={2}>
  <Guideline type="do" text="Place info essential to completing the form outside the field so that it is always visible.">
    <EuiFormRow label="Source" helpText="Enter a valid IP address.">
      <EuiFieldText placeholder="192.168.132.6" />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline type="dont" text="Use text that adds no value, such as “Type here”.">
    <EuiFormRow
      label="Source"
      helpText="Enter CIDR or IP address. For example, `192.168.132.6/22`."
    >
      <EuiFieldText placeholder="Type here" />
    </EuiFormRow>
  </Guideline>

  <Guideline
    text="When space is limited and the UI is very simple, you can use field labels as placeholder text. This must stay an exception."
    panelStyle={{ minBlockSize: 94 }}
  >
    <EuiFlexGroup>
      <EuiFlexItem>
        <EuiFormRow>
          <EuiFieldText placeholder="Key" />
        </EuiFormRow>
      </EuiFlexItem>
      <EuiFlexItem>
        <EuiFormRow>
          <EuiFieldText placeholder="Value" />
        </EuiFormRow>
      </EuiFlexItem>
      <EuiFlexItem grow={false}>
        <EuiFormRow>
          <EuiButton>Add</EuiButton>
        </EuiFormRow>
      </EuiFlexItem>
    </EuiFlexGroup>
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline type="dont" text="If space allows it, prefer following the rule described earlier with labels outside of the fields.">
    <EuiFlexGroup>
      <EuiFlexItem>
        <EuiFormRow label="Key">
          <EuiFieldText />
        </EuiFormRow>
      </EuiFlexItem>
      <EuiFlexItem>
        <EuiFormRow label="Value">
          <EuiFieldText />
        </EuiFormRow>
      </EuiFlexItem>
      <EuiFlexItem grow={false}>
        <EuiFormRow hasEmptyLabelSpace>
          <EuiButton>Add</EuiButton>
        </EuiFormRow>
      </EuiFlexItem>
    </EuiFlexGroup>
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGrid>

In a search bar, be specific about what users can enter.

import { EuiFieldSearch } from '@elastic/eui';

<EuiFlexGrid columns={2}>
  <Guideline type="do" text="Give users a hint at things they might want to search for. State the action the user performs (find, search) instead of the field functionality (jump to).">
    <EuiFieldSearch
      placeholder="Find apps and content. Ex: Discover"
      value=""
      onChange={() => {}}
    />
  </Guideline>
  <Guideline type="dont" text="Use an ellipsis.">
    <EuiFieldSearch
      placeholder="Search..."
      value=""
      onChange={() => {}}
    />
  </Guideline>
</EuiFlexGrid>
